lead_paragraph: The findings of the agency’s internal inspector general suggests the federal government should shoulder some of the blame for the city water supply’s continued lead contamination.

headline.print_headline: Report Faults E.P.A. on Response to Flint
headline.main: E.P.A. Waited Too Long to Warn of Flint Water Danger, Report Says

snippet: The findings of the agency’s internal inspector general suggests the federal government should shoulder some of the blame for the city water supply’s continued lead contamination....
abstract: Inspector general for Environmental Protection Agency issues report showing agency could have issued emergency order under Safe Drinking Water Act, warning Flint, Mich, residents of lead-contaminated water, seven months earlier than it actually did.
